qas.question: What observations in astronomy did China record?
What kind of predictions were made during the 12th century?
What year did Chinese astronomers start to observe comets?
How many records of sunspots are there?

context: Astronomy: Astronomical observations from China constitute the longest continuous sequence from any civilisation and include records of <a0_0>sunspots<a0_0/> (<a4_0>112<a4_0/> records from 364 BC), supernovas (1054), lunar and solar eclipses. By the 12th century, they could reasonably accurately make predictions of <a1_0>eclipses<a1_0/>, but the knowledge of this was lost during the Ming dynasty, so that the <a2_0>Jesuit Matteo Ricci<a2_0/> gained much favour in 1601 by his predictions. By <a3_0>635<a3_0/> Chinese astronomers had observed that the tails of comets always point away from the sun.
